detailed_info.name: Cetrimonium Chloride
detailed_info.description:
Cetrimonium chloride is a quaternary ammonium used in cosmetics for its antistatic properties. As it is a cationic surfactant, it disperses water and oil, and thus promote soft and pleasant consistencies. This ingredient is often used in hair care instead and sometimes with silicones. It can also be used as a preservative.

Â In 2010, in a report of opinions, the Scientific Committee for Consumer Safety (CSSC) concluded that "In addition to the fact that quaternary ammonium derivative formulations have an irritating potential, especially when combinations of the compounds concerned The SCCS states that the use of CETRIMONIUM CHLORIDE, STEARTRIMONIUM CHLORIDE and BEHENTRIMONIUM CHLORIDE does not pose a risk to consumer health "when used within the regulated concentration limits (see below).
detailed_info.regulation:
The restrictions are dependent on the use of the ingredient in:
a) Rinsing products for hair and facial hair
b) Non-rinsing products for hair and facial hair
c) Products without rinsing for the face

The maximum permitted concentrations are:
(a) 2.5% for individual concentrations or the sum of the individual concentrations of cetrimonium chloride and steartrimonium chloride.
(b) 1.0% for individual concentrations or the sum of the individual concentrations of cetrimonium chloride and steartrimonium chloride.
(c) 0.5% for individual concentrations or the sum of the individual concentrations of cetrimonium chloride and steartrimonium chloride.

For purposes other than inhibiting the development of microorganisms in the product. This purpose must be apparent from the presentation of the product
detailed_info.reference: SCCS - OPINION ON ALKYL (C16, C18, C22) TRIMETHYLAMMONIUM CHLORIDE For other uses than as a preservative - (2010) http://ec.europa.eu/health/scientific_committees/consumer_safety/docs/sccs_o_012.pdf

functions.name: Antimicrobial
functions.description: Helps slowing the growth of micro-organisms on the skin and counteracts the development of microbes

functions.name: Antistatic
functions.description: Reduces static electricity by neutralizing electrical charge on a surface

functions.name: Emulsifying
functions.description: Promotes the formation of intimate mixtures between immiscible liquids by modifying the interfacial tension (water and oil)

functions.name: Preservative
functions.description: Inhibits the development of microorganisms in cosmetic products.
